ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What is the matter with them that they have no iman
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So, wherefore do they not believe?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So, what is the matter with them that they do not believe,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: What is the matter with them? Why do they not believe?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: What is the matter with them that they do not accept faith?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: What is the matter with them, that they believe not
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But what is the matter with them that they do not believe,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then what ails them, that they believe not,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: What aileth them, then, that they believe not
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: What is wrong with them that they do not believe?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: What aileth them then, that they believe not,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: What is the matter with them that they will not believe,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: What then is the matter with them, that they believe not?-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: What is the matter with them, that they believe not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: What is the matter with them, that they do not believe
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: What is the matter with them that they do not believe?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [84:20] So what is wrong with them, that is, the disbelievers, that they do not have faith, that is to say, what is there to prevent them from [embracing] faith; or what argument do they have for neglecting it despite the existence of proofs for it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (What aileth them) the disbelievers of Mecca; and it is said this refers to the three sons of 'Abd Yalayl al- Thaqafi: Mas'ud, Habib and Rabi'ah, the last two had later on accepted Islam (then, that they believe not) in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an.
